intro: Mapania hispida, commonly known as the hairy mapania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and bloom in clusters. Mapania hispida is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
